high.name: CI/CD Pipelines (Jenkins, GitLab CI, GitHub Actions)

easy: Strong Kubernetes & Terraform experience is essential
Build production-ready CI/CD pipelines for real projects
doable: Solid GitOps experience with Argo CD or Flux
Production incident management and on-call experience
challenging: Advanced Kubernetes at scale (multi-cluster, service mesh)
Strong automation skills - Python/Bash for infrastructure
Security focus: secrets management, DevSecOps practices
stretch: Platform engineering mindset and internal tooling experience
Deep SRE knowledge: SLOs, error budgets, chaos engineering
Strong portfolio with complex infrastructure projects

rounds.name: Technical Screening
points: Deep dive into Kubernetes: pod lifecycle, deployments, services, ingress
Terraform questions: state management, modules, workspaces
CI/CD pipeline design and troubleshooting scenarios
Discuss your experience with production incidents and resolutions

rounds.name: Infrastructure Design Round
points: Design a complete CI/CD pipeline for a microservices application
Infrastructure as Code: write Terraform for multi-tier architecture
Discuss monitoring, logging, and alerting strategy
Address scalability, reliability, and cost optimization

rounds.name: Hands-On DevOps Challenge
points: Debug a broken Kubernetes deployment or CI/CD pipeline
Write automation scripts (Python/Bash) to solve infrastructure problems
Optimize existing infrastructure or deployment workflows
Demonstrate troubleshooting methodology and root cause analysis

rounds.name: System Reliability & Incident Management
points: Discuss past production incidents: how you detected, debugged, and resolved
Monitoring & observability: Prometheus queries, Grafana dashboards
On-call experience and incident response procedures
SRE concepts: SLOs, error budgets, post-mortems

rounds.name: Hiring Manager / Cultural Fit
points: Career transition story: how you moved into DevOps from non-tech
Collaboration with development teams and stakeholders
Learning mindset: staying current with cloud-native technologies
Questions about team culture, on-call rotation, and growth path

easy: Production Kubernetes experience with multi-cluster management
Strong CI/CD and GitOps expertise with real-world projects
Solid monitoring stack experience - Prometheus, Grafana, ELK
doable: Advanced Kubernetes: Helm, operators, custom resources
Production incident response and SRE mindset
challenging: Deep infrastructure expertise across cloud providers
Platform engineering: building internal developer platforms
Strong security focus: DevSecOps, compliance, secrets management
stretch: This requires 1+ years of dedicated DevOps production experience
Certifications help: CKA, AWS Solutions Architect, Terraform Associate
Referrals and strong portfolio projects are highly valuable

rounds.name: Online Assessment
points: 3-4 coding problems ranging from easy to medium difficulty
Focus on JavaScript problem-solving and algorithmic thinking
May include frontend-specific challenges (DOM manipulation, async operations)
Passing score typically 60-70% to proceed to interviews

rounds.name: DSA Round 1
points: 1-2 medium problems on arrays, strings, or hash maps
Expected to arrive at optimal solution with hints
Code on shared editors like CoderPad or HackerRank
Interviewer evaluates problem-solving approach and communication

rounds.name: DSA Round 2 / Frontend Fundamentals
points: Could be another DSA round or deep dive into JavaScript internals
Topics: closures, prototypes, event loop, promises, this keyword
Questions on React: virtual DOM, reconciliation, hooks, performance
Write code to demonstrate concepts (e.g., implement Promise.all)

rounds.name: Machine Coding / UI Round
points: Build a real-world component: search with autocomplete, pagination, filters
Use React or vanilla JavaScript based on company preference
Focus on code organization, reusability, and edge case handling
Bonus points for responsive design and accessibility considerations

rounds.name: Hiring Manager / Bar Raiser
points: Behavioral questions using STAR format (Situation, Task, Action, Result)
Deep dive into your best project - technical decisions and trade-offs
Questions about handling challenges, tight deadlines, and collaboration
Culture fit assessment - research company values beforehand

easy: Basic Linux, networking, and scripting fundamentals
Familiarity with Docker, Jenkins, and basic CI/CD concepts
doable: Solid Kubernetes fundamentals and container orchestration
Basic monitoring setup with Prometheus or CloudWatch
challenging: Production CI/CD pipeline experience with Jenkins/GitLab CI
Configuration management with Ansible or similar tools
stretch: Service companies value communication and cultural fit highly
Focus on practical skills and certifications (AWS, Azure basics)
Strong fundamentals matter more than cutting-edge tools

rounds.name: Aptitude & Online Test
points: Quantitative aptitude, logical reasoning, and verbal ability
1-2 easy coding problems (basic loops, conditionals, arrays)
MCQs on HTML, CSS, JavaScript basics
Focus on accuracy over speed - cutoff-based filtering

rounds.name: Technical Interview 1
points: Questions on HTML tags, CSS selectors, and JavaScript syntax
Explain concepts: var vs let vs const, event delegation, box model
Simple coding: reverse a string, find duplicates in array
Project discussion - be ready to explain your contributions clearly

rounds.name: Technical Interview 2
points: Deeper dive into JavaScript: closures, hoisting, callbacks
Basic React questions if it's on your resume: JSX, props, state
May ask to build a simple layout or debug existing code
Focus on fundamentals - breadth over depth

rounds.name: HR Interview
points: Standard questions: strengths, weaknesses, why this company
Career goals and willingness to learn new technologies
Salary expectations (be realistic for fresher roles)
Relocation flexibility and notice period discussion

easy: Deep infrastructure expertise across AWS/Azure/GCP at scale
Strong system design & distributed systems knowledge
doable: Advanced SRE: chaos engineering, capacity planning, error budgets
Platform engineering: building internal developer platforms
challenging: Leadership: mentoring, incident command, technical decision-making
Strong portfolio demonstrating complex infrastructure projects
stretch: This is the highest bar - expect 6-8 rounds of rigorous interviews
Referrals are critical - network with engineers at these companies
Consider 2-3+ years of solid DevOps/SRE experience before applying

rounds.name: Recruiter Screen
points: Initial call to verify your background and interest
Overview of the interview process and timeline
Questions about visa status, location preferences, start date
Opportunity to ask about the team and role expectations

rounds.name: Phone/Online Technical Screen
points: 1-2 coding problems on shared editor (CoderPad, Google Docs)
Medium difficulty - arrays, strings, hash maps, or trees
Focus on clean code, edge cases, and optimal time complexity
Strong communication is essential - think out loud throughout

rounds.name: Onsite: Coding Round 1
points: Medium to hard DSA problem with live whiteboard or code editor
Common topics: dynamic programming, trees, graphs, recursion
Interviewer evaluates problem breakdown and optimization
Expect follow-up questions to extend or modify your solution

rounds.name: Onsite: Coding Round 2
points: Another DSA problem, potentially harder or different domain
May involve advanced data structures or complex logic
Write clean, bug-free code under time pressure
Discuss multiple approaches before settling on implementation

rounds.name: Onsite: Frontend System Design
points: Design a frontend system: autocomplete, infinite scroll, feed
Cover component architecture, state management, API design
Discuss performance: lazy loading, code splitting, caching
Address accessibility, error handling, and edge cases

rounds.name: Onsite: Behavioral / Googleyness
points: Amazon: Leadership Principles with STAR format
Google: Googleyness - collaboration, growth mindset, adaptability
Prepare stories about ownership, conflict, learning from failure
Questions like 'Tell me about a time you had to learn something new quickly'

rounds.name: Hiring Committee & Team Match
points: Google: Packet reviewed by hiring committee for final decision
Amazon: Bar raiser provides independent assessment
Team matching calls to find mutual fit
Process can take 2-4 weeks post-onsite

phases.title: Advanced Kubernetes & Cloud Architecture

whatYouLearn.title: Production Kubernetes at Scale
whatYouLearn.description: Multi-cluster management, custom resources, operators, Helm chart development, and advanced networking (service mesh, ingress)

whatYouLearn.title: Multi-Cloud Infrastructure Architecture
whatYouLearn.description: Design scalable architectures across AWS, Azure, GCP. Master VPCs, load balancing, auto-scaling, and disaster recovery

whatYouLearn.title: Advanced Terraform & IaC
whatYouLearn.description: Terraform modules, workspaces, remote state management, policy as code (OPA, Sentinel), and GitOps workflows

phases.target: Manage production Kubernetes clusters and multi-cloud infrastructure at scale
whyItMatters: Kubernetes is the de-facto standard for container orchestration
Multi-cloud expertise is highly valued for mid-senior DevOps roles
Advanced IaC skills separate mid-level from entry-level engineers

phases.title: SRE Principles & Reliability Engineering

whatYouLearn.title: Observability & Monitoring Mastery
whatYouLearn.description: Build comprehensive monitoring stacks: Prometheus, Grafana, ELK/Loki for logging, Jaeger for distributed tracing

whatYouLearn.title: Incident Management & On-Call
whatYouLearn.description: Incident response, root cause analysis, post-mortems, on-call rotation best practices, and runbook automation

whatYouLearn.title: Service Level Objectives (SLOs/SLIs)
whatYouLearn.description: Define and implement SLOs, error budgets, alerting strategies, and capacity planning for production systems

phases.target: Ensure high reliability and uptime for production systems as an SRE
whyItMatters: SRE skills are essential for mid-level DevOps progression
Production reliability expertise commands premium compensation
Incident management experience is critical for senior roles

phases.title: Security & Compliance (DevSecOps)

whatYouLearn.title: DevSecOps & Security Automation
whatYouLearn.description: Container security scanning (Trivy, Aqua), SAST/DAST tools, security testing in CI/CD pipelines

whatYouLearn.title: Secrets Management & Zero-Trust
whatYouLearn.description: HashiCorp Vault, AWS Secrets Manager, secret rotation, zero-trust networking, and mTLS

whatYouLearn.title: Compliance & Policy as Code
whatYouLearn.description: Implement compliance frameworks (SOC2, GDPR, HIPAA), policy enforcement with OPA/Kyverno, audit logging

phases.target: Build secure infrastructure with automated compliance and secrets management
whyItMatters: Security is non-negotiable in production environments
DevSecOps expertise is in high demand across industries
Compliance knowledge is essential for enterprise roles

phases.title: Platform Engineering & Leadership

whatYouLearn.title: Internal Developer Platforms (IDPs)
whatYouLearn.description: Build self-service platforms for developers, golden paths, developer portals (Backstage), and platform as a product

whatYouLearn.title: Advanced GitOps & Automation
whatYouLearn.description: Argo CD/Flux advanced patterns, progressive delivery (canary, blue-green), chaos engineering with Litmus

whatYouLearn.title: Leadership & Mentorship
whatYouLearn.description: Technical decision-making, architecture reviews, mentoring junior engineers, and cross-team collaboration

phases.target: Lead platform engineering initiatives and mentor teams towards SRE/DevOps excellence
whyItMatters: Platform engineering is the evolution of DevOps for 2024-2025
Leadership skills unlock senior and staff-level roles
Building internal platforms significantly improves developer productivity

projects.title: Production Kubernetes Platform with GitOps
projects.description: Build a production-grade Kubernetes platform with multi-environment support, GitOps workflow using Argo CD, and comprehensive monitoring
projects.shortDescription: Kubernetes platform with GitOps, monitoring, and auto-scaling
projects.fullDescription: Deploy a production-ready Kubernetes cluster on AWS EKS or GCP GKE with complete infrastructure as code using Terraform. Implement GitOps continuous deployment with Argo CD, set up horizontal pod autoscaling, install monitoring stack (Prometheus + Grafana), and configure ingress with SSL. This project demonstrates end-to-end Kubernetes platform engineering skills essential for mid-level DevOps roles.

implementationSteps.title: Provision Kubernetes Cluster with Terraform
implementationSteps.description: Write Terraform code to provision an EKS cluster on AWS or GKE on GCP. Configure node groups with auto-scaling, VPC networking, and IAM roles. Use Terraform modules for reusability. Set up remote state storage in S3/GCS with state locking. Initialize the cluster and verify connectivity with kubectl.

implementationSteps.title: Deploy Sample Microservices Application
implementationSteps.description: Create Kubernetes manifests (Deployments, Services, ConfigMaps) for a multi-tier application (frontend, backend, database). Use Helm charts for packaging. Configure resource requests/limits, health checks (liveness/readiness probes), and environment-specific configurations. Deploy to dev, staging, and production namespaces.

implementationSteps.title: Implement GitOps with Argo CD
implementationSteps.description: Install Argo CD on the cluster. Create Git repository structure for application manifests. Configure Argo CD applications to sync from Git. Implement automated sync policies and rollback capabilities. Set up multi-environment management (dev/staging/prod) with Argo CD ApplicationSets or separate repositories.

implementationSteps.title: Set Up Monitoring & Observability Stack
implementationSteps.description: Deploy Prometheus using Helm chart for metrics collection. Install Grafana and import Kubernetes dashboards (cluster metrics, pod metrics, node metrics). Configure Prometheus ServiceMonitors for application metrics. Set up alerting rules in Prometheus and integrate with Alertmanager. Install Loki for log aggregation and configure log queries in Grafana.

implementationSteps.title: Configure Ingress, SSL & Auto-Scaling
implementationSteps.description: Install NGINX Ingress Controller. Configure Ingress resources to expose services externally. Set up SSL/TLS with cert-manager and Let's Encrypt for automatic certificate management. Configure Horizontal Pod Autoscaler (HPA) based on CPU/memory metrics. Test auto-scaling by generating load with a tool like k6 or Apache Bench. Document the platform architecture and deployment process.

projects.title: Complete CI/CD Pipeline for Microservices
projects.description: Build an end-to-end CI/CD pipeline with Jenkins/GitHub Actions, automated testing, Docker builds, and deployment to Kubernetes
projects.shortDescription: Full CI/CD pipeline with automated testing and deployment
projects.fullDescription: Create a production-ready CI/CD pipeline that automates the entire software delivery lifecycle. Implement automated building, testing, security scanning, Docker image creation, and deployment to Kubernetes. Include multi-stage pipeline with quality gates, integration with Slack/email notifications, and rollback capabilities. This project showcases essential DevOps automation skills for continuous delivery.

implementationSteps.title: Set Up CI/CD Tool & Repository
implementationSteps.description: Choose Jenkins (self-hosted) or GitHub Actions (cloud). For Jenkins, deploy on a VM or Kubernetes with persistent storage. Create a sample microservices application (e.g., Node.js API, Python Flask) with unit tests. Set up Git repository with branching strategy (main, develop, feature branches). Configure webhooks to trigger pipeline on code push.

implementationSteps.title: Build Pipeline Stage - Compile & Test
implementationSteps.description: Create Jenkinsfile or .github/workflows/ci.yml defining pipeline stages. Stage 1: Checkout code from Git. Stage 2: Install dependencies and run unit tests (npm test, pytest). Stage 3: Run linting and code quality checks (ESLint, pylint). Fail the pipeline if tests or quality checks fail. Store test reports as artifacts for review.

implementationSteps.title: Docker Build & Security Scanning
implementationSteps.description: Write Dockerfile with multi-stage build to optimize image size. In pipeline, build Docker image with unique tag (commit SHA or build number). Integrate Trivy or Aqua for container vulnerability scanning. Scan the built image and fail pipeline if high/critical vulnerabilities are found. Push the image to Docker Hub, AWS ECR, or GCR with proper tagging strategy (latest, version, commit SHA).

implementationSteps.title: Deploy to Kubernetes with Quality Gates
implementationSteps.description: Create Kubernetes deployment manifests or Helm charts for the application. In pipeline, authenticate to Kubernetes cluster (kubectl config or service account). Deploy to a staging environment first using kubectl apply or helm upgrade. Run smoke tests against the staging deployment (health check endpoints, basic API tests). Implement approval gate for production deployment (manual approval in Jenkins, GitHub environment protection rules).

implementationSteps.title: Monitoring, Notifications & Rollback
implementationSteps.description: Integrate Slack or email notifications for pipeline status (success, failure, deployment completion). Add pipeline metrics tracking (build duration, success rate). Implement rollback mechanism: store previous successful deployment manifests, create a rollback job that reverts to last known good version. Add deployment dashboard showing recent deployments, current versions in each environment. Document pipeline architecture and troubleshooting guide.

projects.title: Complete Observability Stack for Microservices
projects.description: Build a production-grade observability stack with Prometheus, Grafana, ELK/Loki, distributed tracing, and comprehensive alerting
projects.shortDescription: Full observability: metrics, logs, traces, and alerting
projects.fullDescription: Deploy a comprehensive observability platform covering all three pillars: metrics (Prometheus + Grafana), logs (ELK stack or Loki), and traces (Jaeger or Tempo). Implement application instrumentation, create custom dashboards, set up intelligent alerting rules, and configure on-call rotation with PagerDuty/Opsgenie. This advanced project demonstrates SRE-level monitoring expertise essential for managing production systems at scale.

implementationSteps.title: Deploy Prometheus & Grafana
implementationSteps.description: Install Prometheus using Helm chart with persistent storage configured. Deploy Grafana and connect to Prometheus data source. Configure Prometheus to scrape metrics from Kubernetes nodes, pods, and services. Install kube-state-metrics for Kubernetes cluster monitoring. Import pre-built Grafana dashboards for Kubernetes monitoring (cluster overview, node metrics, pod metrics). Create custom Grafana dashboard for application-specific metrics.

implementationSteps.title: Set Up Logging Stack (ELK or Loki)
implementationSteps.description: Choose ELK Stack (Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana) or Grafana Loki. For Loki: deploy using Helm, configure Promtail as log collector on all nodes. For ELK: deploy Elasticsearch cluster (3 nodes for production), install Logstash for log processing, deploy Kibana for visualization. Configure log parsing and indexing. Set up log retention policies. Create log queries and visualizations in Kibana or Grafana. Integrate application logs with structured logging (JSON format).

implementationSteps.title: Implement Distributed Tracing
implementationSteps.description: Deploy Jaeger or Grafana Tempo for distributed tracing. Instrument a sample microservices application with OpenTelemetry (supports multiple languages: Java, Node.js, Python, Go). Configure trace collection and storage. Create service dependency graphs to visualize microservices communication. Set up trace sampling to manage data volume. Build custom queries to troubleshoot slow requests and performance bottlenecks across services.

implementationSteps.title: Configure Intelligent Alerting
implementationSteps.description: Deploy Alertmanager for Prometheus alerts. Create alerting rules for critical metrics: high CPU/memory usage, pod restarts, disk space, API error rates, latency thresholds. Configure alert routing: different severity levels (warning, critical), route to appropriate channels (Slack, email, PagerDuty). Implement alert grouping and deduplication to reduce noise. Set up silences for planned maintenance. Create runbooks for common alerts linked in alert notifications.

implementationSteps.title: Build SRE Dashboard & On-Call Integration
implementationSteps.description: Create a unified SRE dashboard in Grafana showing: service health status, SLO/SLI metrics (availability, latency percentiles), error budgets, recent incidents. Integrate with incident management platform (PagerDuty, Opsgenie, or VictorOps) for on-call rotation. Configure escalation policies and on-call schedules. Set up incident response workflow: alert → incident creation → page on-call engineer. Add correlation between metrics, logs, and traces for faster root cause analysis. Document observability architecture and troubleshooting playbooks.
